questions.uddipok:
Read the following text and fill in each gap with a suitable word based on the information of the text :
Air pollution comes from a wide variety of sources. In Bangladesh poisonous exhausts from industrial plants, brick kilns, old or poorly serviced vehicles and dust from roads and construction sites are some of the major sources of air pollution. We can minimise this type of pollution by making less use of motor vehicles and avoiding the use of vehicles older than 20 years. We may also use proper lubricants to lessen the level of emission and pollutants. We can encourage people to use Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) or Liquid Petroleum Gas (LPG) for fuelling their cars. The government may relocate hazardous industries like brick kilns to areas away from human habitations.
.
Air is the most important element of human environment. Man cannot (a) —— a single moment without air. But (b) —— do not think that it is (c) —— who pollute this most vital element. (d) —— the prevention of air pollution we (e) —— avoid the use of vehicles older than 20 years.

sub_questions.explanation:
(a) survive / live
(b) we / people
(c) us
(d) To / For
(e) should / must

questions.uddipok:
Complete the following table with information from the passage.
Stephen Hawking is considered the greatest Physicist after Einstein. He was born in England in 1942. He was very skilled in Mathematics from an early age. He wrote the book "A Brief History of Time: From the Big Bang to Black Holes" in 1988. In his book, he explained cosmology for the general public. It became famous and established his reputation as a great scientist. He received his PhD in Cosmology from Cambridge University in 1968. But fortune did not favour him. In 1972, he became a victim of Gehrig's disease. Since then, he was confined to a wheelchair till his death with no power to control his body. But he continued his teaching through the help of a computer. In 1974, he won the prestigious Albert Einstein award for Theoretical Physics. In 1979, he joined Cambridge University as Lucasian Professor of Mathematics. He carried out his research work using his computer. This great scientist breathed his last on 14 March 2018.
Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation: Stephen Hawking is considered the greatest, Physicist after Albert Einstein. He became popular for writing the book "A Brief History of Time: From the Big Bang to Black Holes" which explained Cosmology for general people. Unfortunately, he was confined to a wheelchair due to Gehrig's disease till his death. But this disease could not stop him from continuing his research. Besides, Hawking, a Ph.D. holder in Cosmology, Iwon the prestigious Albert Einstein Award in 1974. This great scientist kept himself busy in research using his computer. He passed away in 2018.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on 'Traffic Jam'.
(a) What do you mean by traffic jam? (b) What are the causes of traffic jam? (c) What are the effects of traffic jam? (d) When does it occur more? (e) Who are the worst sufferers for traffic jam? (f) How can we remove it?

sub_questions.explanation:
Traffic Jam

Traffic jam is a situation in which a long line of vehicles on a road have stopped moving or are moving very slowly. Nowadays, traffic jam is a common problem in our towns and cities. It causes great sufferings to the passengers and the passers-by. The increasing number of vehicles mostly causes traffic jam. Day by day, the number of vehicles is increasing to meet the needs of the increased population. But the roads are not increasing in that proportion. Many vehicles moving on the same road at a timé' cause traffic jąm. Many drivers do not abide by traffic rules. Besides, the traffic police are not sincere. The tendency of the bus drivers and conductors to get more passengers also causes traffic jam. Some drivers stop buses here and there and board and unboard passengers. This hampers the movement of other vehicles and causes traffic jam. The unlimited number of rickshaws plying on the streets is another cause of traffic jam. The general people have to face untold sufferings. They reach late at their working places. Students, employees, businessmen, workers all suffer tremendously for this. It occurs mostly during office and school or college time. During fraffic jam, we feel extremely bored as it kills our valuable time. To relieve the passengers of the sufferings of traffic jam, some steps should be taken by the government. The drivers who do not abide by traffic rules should be punished. Traffic authority should be active to enforce the traffic rules and maintain the discipline on the roads.

questions.uddipok:
Read the beginning of the story given below. And add at least ten new sentences to complete it. Give a suitable title to it.
Rumana was a student of class ten in Dhaka city. Every morning she started for school and came back home in the afternoon. Oneday after coming back home, to her utter surprise, she found a lock hanging on the door ...

sub_questions.explanation:
Safe Bind, Safe Find

Rumana was a student of class ten in Dhaka city. Every morning, she started for school and came back home in the afternoon. One day after coming back home, to her utter surprise, she found a lock hanging on the door. At first, she tried to open the lock with her key, but it did not budge. She knocked on the door, but no one answered. Panic set in, and she wondered what could have happened.
She felt alone and scared, but she didn't lose hope. She went to the back of the house to see if there was any way she could get in. Fortunately, one of the windows was open. She somehow managed to get inside. The first thing she noticed was that the house was in complete disarray. She realized that something was terribly wrong. Rumana immediately called her parents, and they rushed home.
After investigating, they found out that their house had been robbed while they were away. The robbers had taken all of their valuables, including jewelry, 'electronics, and cash. The incident taught Rumana the importance of being cautious and vigilant. She realized that security was a significant issue and that she needed to take measures to protect her family's belongings. In the end, the incident made Rumana stronger and more responsible. She learned to take charge of her life and to be prepared for the unexpected. She was grateful that she and her family were safe and sound.

sub_questions.explanation:
To : akif15@gmail.com

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Noha and your friend is Mahin. Now, write a dialogue between you and yout friend about the merits and demerits of using mobile phone at teenage.

sub_questions.explanation:
Noha: Hey Mahin! I was reading an article yesterday about how mobile phones affect teenagers. It got me thinking—do you think it's more helpful or harmful?
Mahin: Hey Noha! That’s actually a great topic. I think it’s a bit of both. Mobile phones are super helpful for staying connected and accessing information, but they also have their downsides.
Noha: Totally agree. Like, one of the biggest merits is easy communication. We can call, text, or video chat with friends and family anytime.
Mahin: Yeah, and educational apps and online resources make studying easier too. We can watch tutorials, join online classes, and even do research quickly.
Noha: Right. But on the flip side, many teens get addicted to social media and games. That really affects their studies and sleep.
Mahin: Exactly. And some even suffer from anxiety or low self-esteem because of comparing themselves to others on social media.
Noha: Another issue is less face-to-face interaction. I feel like teens are losing social skills because they’re always on their phones.
Mahin: True. Plus, spending too much time staring at screens can cause eye problems and other health issues.
Noha: But still, if we use mobile phones responsibly, they can be very useful. It’s all about balance, right?
Mahin: Definitely. Using phones wisely can make teenage life easier and more productive, but overuse can lead to serious problems.
Noha: Well said, Mahin. I think every teen should know both sides before using a phone too much.
Mahin: For sure. Awareness is the first step to using technology in a healthy way
